instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1707: What is A1707? A1707 is a model number for a 15 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Late 2016, Mid 2017 with EMC 3072, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00281, 820-00928..
definitions.820-00281: What is 820-00281? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>, install osx pb
threads.message:
<MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>, after installing the OSX. get on a black screen and just the cursor.
even i can't boot from my USB OSX.
after the apple logo and the bar progress, I have a black screen and the mouse cursor.
before it had an operating system but the screen was broken, but I saw it on external video

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>, install osx pb
threads.message:
What macOS version installed?
I think someone reported similar issue after Catalina installation; solved reflashing BIOS...

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>, install osx pb
threads.message:
i tried high sierra and mojave
what did you mean with reflashing? cleaning ME region?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>, install osx pb
threads.message:
NO, flash full known good working BIOS; with clean ME, of course.
Easy to do with Medusa, which can also fix Fsys checksum after changing serial number.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>, install osx pb
threads.message:
ok, i found one but no the same ME, version it is okay ? 
after i found the good one i have to replace the Fsys bloc. thats all ?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>, install osx pb
threads.message:
If you replace entire Fsys area, no need to fix checksum.
Be sure to clean ME correctly; must be the same version...

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>, install osx pb
threads.message:
i can't find working bios with cleaned ME Region.
do you have one or you could repair my original image ?

[url]https://drive.google.com/open?id=1PouV_m9eQ9EQ-GpSLDjHA-hfbIoRsvGT[/url]

the method that i used to clean the ME section, was to find 'kird' world in my original bin image and replace this section. 
but I didn't find it...

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>, install osx pb
threads.message:
I think already passed you the link to correct method on other post.
Replace is the laziest way showed on YouTube and used by vinafix "hig-techs"; as many others too, including paid software.
None of them understand what they even done!

Use win-raid.com manual, or get Medusa.
On the forum we also have all the (resumed) steps to follow; use search function.

In the mean time, I can try to build one BIOS file.
Which is the exact board model?

threads.message:

It is <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> emc 3072, i7-6820HQ 2.9ghz
C02SR7PTGTFL

any other information you need ?

Thanks again.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>, install osx pb
threads.message:
Unfortunately, it not working the board power one but always the same problem,
the Apple logo appears and progress bar progress then it disappears and just I see the mouse cursor.
by the way, when I was flashing the bios by using ezp201, it gives me an error for the last step of verification. but it read and write normally.
I am thinking now the board won't open the system for another problem.
because it tried another bio, always the same problem. but i wasn't sure it was a clean ME or not

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>, install osx pb
threads.message:
Be sure to pass verify step after flashing BIOS.

Disconnect internal LCD and test it with external monitor.
Re-check all the connectors you've touched when changed the LCD.
Also try through USB disconnecting J9600.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>, install osx pb
threads.message:
Okay, if you want the verify step pass please verify the bios building. 
because I think it is the problem. It tried to burn it on the 2 different chip the same error

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>, install osx pb
threads.message:
BIOS file I sent has exactly 8MB.
No matters what has inside, you MUST pass the verify when write.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>, install osx pb
threads.message: Now sometimes it give me this message

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>, install osx pb
threads.message:
If the file has exactly 8MB (8192KB-dec, 800000-hex), no matters what information is on it.
The programmer MUST write and verify it.
Check if your download is complete.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>, install osx pb
threads.message:
okay, It succeeded the bios flashed with no problem. 
but always the same problem, nothing on the screen after loading...

I will explain to you the history of this MacBook maybe it will help.
I bought it form a job lot, this post was before i replace the screen ( [URL="https://boards.rossmanngroup.com/forum/board-repair-troubleshooting/55921-<MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>-no-image-on-screen-touch-bar-had-random-pixels-colors"]https://boards.rossmanngroup.com/for...-pixels-colors[/URL] )
i succeed once to see the login screen on external video.
I bought the LCD and I replaced it, in time i kept the MacBook open but well stored. 
i replaced one of the usb c flex, because I toked it for another repair.
the battery of the MacBook had a dead cell(like a balloon ), i bought one but not arrived yet.

i can only see a graphical interface in recovery mood, boot from USB osx install, I tried HighSierra, Catalina, Mojave 
i tried to remove LCD flex and start it on external, keyboard flex, mouse, touch bar, fans ...

are you sure form the source of your bios? already working? 

what do you think? thanks for your help

threads.message:
ok, i did new experiment, i replaced the battery and cleaned the board in a ultrasound cleaner. 
after I succeed once to boot it from an external drive with high Sierra, but It was wired. Stuck on every operation I will attach photos.
Every 10 sec it stuck and the colors circle appear, and it load.

After I tried on the safe mode it boot and I can enter the system normally.

Without safe mode it take long time on apple logo and restart.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>, install osx pb
threads.message:
Try to run HWMonitor, if possible.
If runs in safe mode, can be a driver issue caused by some device.
See what happens disconnecting camera.
